isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - IC BUS SERVICE MANUAL - OPERATION - AIR CIRCULATION

svcsubproc.title: Heater/Defroster Controls
svcsubproc.para: The heater controls are located on the left side driver's console ( Figure 9). A separate rocker switch controls each blower motor.

svcsubproc.title: Fresh Air Vent
svcsubproc.para: The fresh air controls ( Figure 10) are located on the driver's console. To open the fresh air vent, turn the rotary knob as directed. To close the fresh air vent, reverse the operation. NOTE - To reduce condensation requires a mix of outside air with moist inside air. This will require the fresh air vent to be open. This will decrease the humidity in the air by letting outside air in.

svcsubproc.title: Fans
svcsubproc.para: Some school buses are equipped with fans located above the front windshield. These fans are used to circulate air and provide additional defrosting capability. To turn the fan on, locate the control switch on the driver's console ( Figure 11). Each fan has "HIGH" and "LOW" speeds. The fan can be positioned in several directions. To reposition the fan, turn the fan "OFF" and pivot the fan by grasping the cage and turning.

warning.para: The fan motor will become extremely hot due to the ambient temperature or after operating for long periods of time. Wait until the motor cools off before repositioning the fan. Use extreme care!
